page.title: 13SAWMILL, WINDSOR ESTATE.
page.content:
We visited the{Forest}and{Sawmill} which both belong to the Crown Estates. Most of the timber used comes from the{Windsor Estate,}which is the biggest and most valuable of the Crown Estates.
The{forest,}which was planted in 1936,is principally of Scots Pine trees. These grow well in the acid, sandy soils. The trees take 60 years to grow and are planted at a density of 260 trees per hectare. They are thinned after the first twenty years to encourage vigorous growth and afterwards thinned every five years.
The{Swinley Park Sawmill} was built in 1979 and the buildings on the site are used mainly for storage. Some of the planks and posts are also stored outside.
